messages.subject: Re: Subject: Titanic
messages.msgSnippet: ... A good book fiction book about the titanic is Connie Willis _Passage_. Everything she writes is fabulous. Oh, this reminds me of Sharon McCrumb s book
messages.messageBody:
> From: LsMe@...

>
> Thank you both for the warning ... I've never watched Titanic, for the same
> reasons, and now I know I never want to.......!!!!
> Linda
>
> In a message dated 11/24/02 12:19:41 AM Eastern Standard Time,
> grlynbl@... writes:
> I watched it, but I regretted it. I swear, I was in a deep depression for
> days. I just kept thinking. This was REAL. this REALLY happened.. it wasnt
> "just" a movie...
>

A good book fiction book about the titanic is Connie Willis' _Passage_.
Everything she writes is fabulous.

Oh, this reminds me of Sharon McCrumb's book _The PMS Outlaws_ where the
heroine is taking a rest in a psychiatric care facility because her husband
was lost in a storm in the north sea in a small boat and she keeps hoping he's
on an island somewhere. All her roommates keep reminding her of Titanic but
she's blocked the ending. Sharon McCrumb also wrote _Bimbos of the Death Sun_
a mystery that pokes fun at Sci Fi conventions. She is an incredible story
teller in person.

Peggy
